pros: Simple work, low stress, kind chefs, COVID tests, can use the pool and gym, free drinks, break rooms with snacks and a massage chair.
cons: Lack of communication with manager (haven't heard a single thing from them and have only seen them once, pushing carts with stacked dishes is LOUD.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Farmington, MO
pros: Residents in Assisted living were fantastic for the most part.
cons: Short staffed Having to help serve meals and do the clean up after meals Giving the residents shower Never minded those tasks but at times it took precious time away from the nursing side. Especially if there was a fall or sick resident on either assisted living hall or residential hall or the cottages. It's hard to have a hall 20 residents to do CNA , CMT and LPN for. Plus another 30 plus another 50 plus residents you're LPN for. CMTs were great on the other halls of they were good ones and could determine if they needed a PRN med for allergies or constipation. I had the privilege of working with one who passed meds and that was it. If they called me down sh wouldn't even follow up to see if it relieved the symptoms. She was extremely resentful to me as charge nurse at all times. Nothing was ever done about it. She was supposed to have a meeting with the DON and Administrator and I this as way of an apology "Sorry sometimes I'm a b,----.". No write up or any punishment of any kind. I went on medical leave for 4 months and told the new acting DON I wanted days or nights but not evenings, which I had been trying to get off of for several months and was passed over for both shifts as they had to find a replacement. Funny thing is they never ran an ad for my position. Anyway, back to my return, I was on nights for 2 weeks before they put me back on evenings even tho I protested. Then when I had another job and gave my notice askeme what it would take for me to stay. I said nights and $3more an hour, exactly what I was getting at the new job. She said nights I can do but not the increase in pay. Funny thing is now they have raised their pay exactly that. I always volunteered for over time and was very dependable although I didn't get that on my last evaluation as the only problem noted. I also had 5 less callouts than another employee that scored a 4 to my 1. I don't think I was the best employee due to alot of medical problems that weren't figured into my missed days. Enough problems that I required whip employees there that time of working there where I was always hired right back there. X 4.

pros: * Amazing Residents & Families. * Floor Staff Provide Genuinely Holistic Care. * Floor Nursing Staff Perform as a Team. * Residents are treated and cared for like family.
cons: * High turnover rate of nurse leadership. * Poor, little, to no specific &/OR clear clarification--not from nursing or administrative leadership--provided to employees' regarding duties/responsibilities/expectations regarding the specific role/title they hold, and for which are held accountable. * Routinely Inconsistent Implementation of Corrective Action Policies, Dependent Upon Involved Employee. *Hesitance to Report Concerns to Management, Administration, and Human Resources, due to fear of their retaliatory acts--blatant or subtle--or of having been subjected to or witnessed retaliation tactics.* Ongoing & Multiple Types of "Subtle" Workplace Harassment by the "higher-ups"are Targeted & Common--As is Telling Untruths, Half-Truths and Relaying Unethical Insinuations About Employees. Scapegoating and attempts to intimidate employees--again, blatantly or subtly--to cover administrations mistakes, oversights, or other adverse actions is widely recognized, witnessed, and known of by staff in all departments . These Actions Have Been Practiced by Corporate Level Leadership as well, and Witnessed-In-Action.* Increasingly Palpable Stress, Hostility, and Poor Employee Morale Adds to Overall Tension, *

pros:
Never enough staff. Upper staff had no clue what was going on. Nothing was addressed when told things were not going right. Poorest salary in Emporia Ks of the Presbyterian manors
compared  to their other locations. Other resbyterian manors Charge $2 for employee meals but this one charges $4.00. Do not make employees feel appreciated. Do not check on complaints by families or employees. Decreased how PTO is figured twice in a few years. No retirement plans. Best egg university was done away with and employees were not readily notified. Can request PTO but may not get all of what was requested according to how much was requested fired employee is denied their earned PTO. Jobs are changed. Pay for a job is changed location where you are working gets changed ..sometimes more then 3 times in one day. Upper staff demean lower staff.
cons: See above.  They are self insured. Health insurance is alright. The offered dental and vision is very poor coverage.

pros: The building is new, other employees are pleasant, it's easy to make friends with the residents and establish a day to day routine.
cons: They offer NO benefits. Now they have health insurance but it's so expensive no one can afford it due to the low salary and now that insurance has to be offered this is no longer a "benefit" no holiday pay, no 90 day evaluation with pay increase, your not even consider an employee for 1 year, no raise based on job performance only on attendance and everyone gets 3% no more even if you do more.
